title: Level 8 Statistics Practice Test
description: Test your understanding of scatter plots, correlation, probability, two-way tables, and Venn diagrams.

questions.question: A scatter plot shows that as the number of hours of exercise increases, resting heart rate decreases. What type of correlation is this?
questions.explanation: When one variable increases and the other decreases, it is a negative correlation. More exercise is associated with lower resting heart rate.

questions.question: A fair six-sided die is rolled. What is $P(\text{rolling an even number})$?
questions.explanation: Even numbers on a die: 2, 4, 6 â€” that's 3 out of 6 outcomes. $P(\text{even}) = \frac{3}{6} = \frac{1}{2}$.

questions.question: In a class of 28 students, 15 play basketball, 10 play soccer, and 4 play both. How many play at least one sport?
questions.explanation: $n(B \cup S) = n(B) + n(S) - n(B \cap S) = 15 + 10 - 4 = 21$ students play at least one sport.

questions.question: A coin is flipped 100 times and lands on heads 58 times. What is the experimental probability of heads?
Which type of data display is best for showing the relationship between two numerical variables?
questions.explanation: Scatter plots are specifically designed to show the relationship between two numerical variables by plotting data pairs as points.

questions.question: In a two-way table, 20 boys and 15 girls were surveyed. 12 boys and 9 girls prefer maths. What is the probability that a randomly selected student prefers maths?
questions.explanation: Students who prefer maths $= 12 + 9 = 21$. Total students $= 20 + 15 = 35$. $P(\text{prefers maths}) = \frac{21}{35} = \frac{3}{5}$.

questions.question: A bag contains 5 red and 7 blue marbles. What is the probability of drawing a red marble? Give your answer as a simplified fraction.
In a group of 50 people, 30 like tea, 25 like coffee, and 10 like both. How many like neither tea nor coffee?
A die is rolled 200 times and a six appears 40 times. What is the experimental probability of rolling a six? Write as a decimal.
questions.explanation: $P(\text{six}) = \frac{40}{200} = 0.2$. Note this is higher than the theoretical probability of $\frac{1}{6} \approx 0.167$.

questions.question: A spinner has 3 red, 2 blue, and 5 green sections. What is the probability of NOT landing on green? Give your answer as a simplified fraction.
